Rick,
It'd be interesting if there is such a thing.

I think we'd need a faster, higher volume, less man-hour intensive translator than me to find out, though.

Jim



  Jim and Folk -

  I know nothing beyond what is contained in the post.  My guess is 
  that the author is referring to more modern, industrial methods that 
  approximate the tartara but produce tamahagane or a reasonable 
  facsimile without utilizing expensive charcoal and which methods lend 
  themselves to faster, higher volume, less man-hour intensive 
  production.  I think you should go into the listed Japanese sites and 
  translate for us!  ;o)

  NC
